newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia's Sinar Mas to invest $3 bln in China.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia's Sinar Mas to invest $3 bln in China.

text.p: Indonesia's Sinar Mas Group, through its subsidiary Asia Pulp and Paper, plans to invest $3 billion in China, the Bisnis Indonesia daily reported on Tuesday.

The newspaper quoted the founder of Sinar Mas conglomerate Eka Tjipta Widjaja as saying that within three years Asia Pulp and Paper would establish paper plants with a total investment of $3 billion in Chen Chan and Hainan districts of China.
Tjipta Widjaja said his company was expanding overseas because of a mature domestic market and the huge potential of the Chinese market.

Asia said on November 27 it had received Beijing's approval for a $1.5 to $1.8 billion paper and packaging venture in China. It is also building a plant in Yushan which is due to start commercial production by mid-1997.
Indra Widjaja, managing director of Sinar Mas Group, said the group would start joint ventures with local governments.
"We are investing in China because paper exports from Indonesia to China are too costly as the Chinese government imposes a high import tax," Widjaja said.
